Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2012 10:56PM matrix wrote: i do think it depends on where you go. i was sent to an outpatient part of the hospital in salisbury after my pcp felt the lump i had reported. the area she sent me to has a "breast department" where they do ultrasounds and biopsy's. the technician did the ultrasound and then the radiologist came in about 30 mins later and went over the report with me. sometimes they send it to the doctor without talking to you i guess. but he came in and talked to me and told me he thought it was benign but gave me options of waiting, more ultrasounds, or just going ahead and scheduling a biopsy. i went with the biopsy. they scheduled it right there and then i went there to get the biopsy and the doctor that did it also gave me his opinion and went over procedure with me. they scheduled me and appointment to come there to get my results and they have a specialist that will meet with me. if it is benign then they set future appts just to keep checking it. if its cancer he said they will have a plan laid out for me when i come in. all this has been done there without my doctor. she just handled the initial referral and then they have taken over and i am very happy about that. it makes me feel that i am in the best care. if you're not happy with the way they are handling things you might want to see about a specialist in your area. or another doctor. good luck to you!
